humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, one out of six assessed non-sentinel lymph nodes is positive for metastatic carcinoma (1/6). Based on the new rules provided, this corresponds to N1. The report also mentions that there are no metastatic carcinomas in the sentinel lymph nodes (0/2, 0/1, 0/1, 0/1), which supports the N1 classification. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because there is metastatic carcinoma present in 1 out of 6 examined lymph nodes (pN1a), as reported in the 'Non-sentinel lymph node, left axilla, excision' section. The patient has no extracapsular extension, and the largest focus of metastatic tumor measures 0.6 cm.
